metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29405 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description: The go command may execute arbitrary code at build time when using cgo.This may occur when running "go get" on a malicious module, or when runningany other command which builds untrusted code. This is can by triggered bylinker flags, specified via a "#cgo LDFLAGS" directive. Flags containingembedded spaces are mishandled, allowing disallowed flags to be smuggledthrough the LDFLAGS sanitization by including them in the argument ofanother flag. This only affects usage of the gccgo compiler.

criterions.comment: golang-1.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.10: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.13 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.18 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
